result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devine A. Spencer

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:46 pm case called. Defendant Devine A. Spencer in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Devine A. Spencer.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. Thirty days for any motions to be filed. 
A status conference is scheduled for 12/2/22 at 9:30 am (in person).

2:08 PM Defendant Devine A. Spencer in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Thorson in court for Devine A. Spencer.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a Preliminary Hearing. State is in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Parties are ready to proceed. 

State asks that the Court find counts 1 and 2 are transactionally related. Defense does not object for the purpose of this hearing. Court finds that counts 1 and 2 are transactionally related. 

State calls Officer Jacob Roberts, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies Defendant on the record. 
Cross examination by Defense.
Witness steps down.

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Case referred to Br. 5 for scheduling.

9:34 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devine A. Spencer in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Devine A. Spencer. There is an offer from the State but there is no agreement.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with D.L., B.Z.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
No use or possession of firearms or ammunition.
Defendant not to use/possess any controlled substances without prescription.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:08 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Devine A. Spencer appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler appeared by video for Devine A. Spencer.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on July 25, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
